result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah A Loebbaka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. Restitution paid in full. Will be forwarded to West Bend Mutual Insurance.
BAIL APPLIED. Costs paid in full. DNA Surcharge is WAIVED.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No Contact with Farmir K. or Woodman's.

Court finds that if the Defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the Defendant's interest to have this expunged and society will not be harmed and grant expunction.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Elijah A Loebbaka in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed. Reading waived.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Apply bail to costs and restitution and refund balance to poster. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 4 months jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 2 STAYED for 1 year Probation - concurrent to Ct. 2. Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.
- Court Costs of $243.00 - Apply Bail 
- Restitution of $1,151.99 to be paid to West Bend Mutual Insurance - Apply Bail
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No contact with Fatmir K. or Woodmans.  
- Defendant to perform 75 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation.
- 10 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours)  - 1 day credit if revoked - STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 

Defense requests expunction.
State takes no position.
Court finds that if the defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the defendant's interest and society will not be harmed and
grant expunction. 

Ct. 2:
- 2 months jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 1 STAYED for 1 year Probation - concurrent to Ct. 1. Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.
- Court Costs of $243.00 - Apply Bail 
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No contact with Fatmir K. or Woodmans.  

Defense requests expunction.
State takes no position.
Court finds that if the defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the defendant's interest and society will not be harmed and
grant expunction.
Dated July 29, 2015 filed by Attorney Cotton advising the parties have reached an agreement.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
